Title: Engageret og serviceminded intern IT-konsulent
Description: Blue Water har travlt, og vi har gang i mange spændende IT-projekter. Derfor søger vi en engageret og serviceminded intern IT-konsulent til Blue Waters hovedkontor i Esbjerg. Du får ansvar for interne IT projekter. Dine opgaver er alsidige og vil bl.a. indeholde:
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job hos Blue Water Shipping A/S (3) Job i Sydjylland kategoriseret i IT-drift og support (39) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-16 18:31:06. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-16 18:31:06. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Arbejdsmiljø Blue Water Shipping beskytter medarbejdernes sundhed og sikkerhed ved: At sørge for og vedligeholde et sikkert arbejdsmiljø At sørge for faciliteter til sundhed og sikkerhed At sikre, at al udstyr er sikkert Læs mere om vores arbejdsmiljø En spændende hverdag i en international virksomhed I Blue Water Shipping tilbyder vi vores medarbejdere en attraktiv hverdag med udfordringer. Vores medarbejdere er det absolut vigtigste aktiv og er fundamentet for vores succes. Læs mere Mød en medarbejder Blue Water er sted man har lyst til at være! Selv startede jeg som elev i 2010, og som nyansat i BWS oplever man hurtig hvad "Blue Water Ånden" indebærer - vinderattitude, team spirit og godt humør. Samtidig bærer hverdagen i høj grad præg af "frihed under ansvar". Læs mere Engageret og serviceminded intern IT-konsulent Blue Water har travlt, og vi har gang i mange spændende IT-projekter. Derfor søger vi en engageret og serviceminded intern IT-konsulent til Blue Waters hovedkontor i Esbjerg. Stillingen Du får ansvar for interne IT projekter. Dine opgaver er alsidige og vil bl.a. indeholde: Drive implementering af projekter i samarbejde med kollegaer og evt. leverandører Udvikle og vedligeholde software i samarbejde med forretningen Dokumentation og overdragelse til IT support og IT Drift 2’nd level software support Dine kvalifikationer Du er uddannet datamatiker eller lignende. Du har nogle års erfaring med at arbejde med kundesupport og support af software. Det er en fordel, hvis du kender til arbejdet med IT softwareprojekter og har erfaring med: Microsoft Dynamics AX SQL ERP systemer generelt BI systemer Integrationer XML Documentation Vi ser gerne at du har en god forretningsforståelse, og at du er selvstændig. I dit arbejde demonstrerer du køligt overblik og flair for at prioritere dine opgaver, og du siger ikke nej til udfordringer – for dem kommer der mange af. Desuden er det vigtigt, at du kommunikerer sikkert på både dansk og engelsk. Blue Water tilbyder dig Hvis du er vores nye kollega, kan du se frem til en hverdag i en global speditions- og shippingvirksomhed, hvor teamwork prioriteres meget højt. Herudover tilbyder vi en række attraktive personalegoder, bl.a. sundhedsforsikring, kantineordning og sociale arrangementer. Yderligere oplysninger Du er velkommen til at kontakte Petter Jull på telefon: 7913 4058. Hvis du er klar til at tage imod udfordringen, skal du sende din ansøgning på vores hjemmeside: www.bws.dk eller på dette linket nedenfor. Tiltrædelse efter aftale. Send ansøgning

Title: Experienced Content Management Specialist for IT Operations
Description: NNIT is seeking a Content Management Specialist with extensive experience within SharePoint operation for our team in IT Operations. As Content Management Specialist you will join the Application Services area where you will be part of our global organisation with colleagues in China, the Czech Republic as well as Søborg and Århus in Denmark. You will be joining a team of 11 ambitious specialists in DK that are responsible for ensuring the stable operation of our customers’ content management systems. This includes solving complex issues on existing customer platforms, optimizations and improvements as well as implementation of new content management platforms.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i IT-drift og support (117) Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Database (96) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-16 18:57:06. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-16 18:57:06. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. www.nnit.com Application deadline: 03/02/2016 Location: Søborg Contact information: Mette Pind Sonne Telephone: +45 30778068 Tips for your application See all vacant positions Experienced Content Management Specialist for IT Operations NNIT is seeking a Content Management Specialist with extensive experience within SharePoint operation for our team in IT Operations. As Content Management Specialist you will join the Application Services area where you will be part of our global organisation with colleagues in China, the Czech Republic as well as Søborg and Århus in Denmark. Your responsibilities as a Content Management Specialist You will be joining a team of 11 ambitious specialists in DK that are responsible for ensuring the stable operation of our customers’ content management systems. This includes solving complex issues on existing customer platforms, optimizations and improvements as well as implementation of new content management platforms. You will work with a variety of content management environments for our customers – and your responsibilities will include: Daily operations and maintenance of content management platforms based on SharePoint, Sitecore, EPIServer, Umbraco and Domino Notes. Participation in NNIT Operation Centre supporting customers with a variety of SharePoint cases. Engage in daily communication and consultancy with our customers concerning both technical and business perspectives. Participation in customer projects such as installation, upgrade and migration of content management platforms. Contribution to service development, optimization and automation initiatives. Preparation and update of documentation. The success of the Content Management team relies on each team member and it is important that you participate actively in lifting the team’s responsibilities. Together with your colleagues you take the part in ensuring that NNIT’s services appear seamless and coherent to our customers. You understand the importance of the work in highly regulated industries and you accept that sometime the formalities may demand work besides the technical part. For you the job is not done until the documentation is in place and traceability has been demonstrated. The daily operation will be grounded in the ITIL framework. As an experienced Content Management Specialist you help to keep us at the forefront of knowledge about the professional and technological developments within content management platforms and you will contribute actively to the further improvement, documentation and operation of our customers’ environments. The team is part of IT Operations Services responsible for everything from infrastructure and applications to complete orchestration and support of our customers’ IT solutions. Our work processes are based on best practice and our procedures follow ITIL standards (IT Infrastructure Library). Your qualifications and experience You have experience with operation of infrastructure, servers and IIS. You have a general knowledge and interest in content management systems - preferably with focus on SharePoint. A master's degree is ideal, but a long relevant experience can be just as crucial. Furthermore it would be preferable if you have experience within the following technologies/frameworks: Windows Server AD SQL Microsoft SharePoint Office 365/SharePoint Online Sitecore Internet Information Services (IIS) PowerShell EPIServer Umbraco ITIL Framework You are ambitious with the quality of your work and you speak and write fluent Danish and English. You demonstrate excellent self-management skills. Send application Read more about working at NNIT Conditions and employee benefits About NNIT IT ADVISORY, DEVELOPMENT & OUTSOURCING NNIT is a fast-growing IT company with ambitious goals. We supply IT services to large enterprises and the life science industry that demand high levels of quality and security. At NNIT, you can make your mark on some of the most challenging projects in the IT industry, on our journey forward as a company, and on your own career. We take on the responsibility for our clients’ IT as if it were our own, and we live our values every day, so you should be able to see yourself in them. We are: Conscience driven. Value adding. Open and honest. We regard diversity as a strength and support equal opportunities for all. We encourage applications from people of all ages, genders, nationalities, religions and ethnic backgrounds.

Title: Løsningsorienteret BI-udvikler med stærke tekniske kompetencer
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job hos Region Midtjylland (166) Job i Region Midtjylland kategoriseret i Økonomi- og virksomhedssystemer (48) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-17 03:21:44. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-17 03:21:44. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Løsningsorienteret BI-udvikler med stærke tekniske kompetencer Ansøgningsfrist: 7. februar 2016 Stillingsbetegnelse.: IT Tiltrædelse: 1. april 2016 Arbejdssted: Regionshuset  Aarhus Afdeling: It-BI-kontoret Beskæftigelsestype: Fast Arbejdstid: Fuldtid Kontaktperson : Jonas Eskildsen Sørensen Telefon: 6094 3425 Kontakt: Ursula Harboe (ved administrative spørgsmål) Telefon: urshar@rm.dk Del: Facebook Twitter LinkedIn E-mail Udskriv Er du en af de bedste inden for BI, og ønsker du at arbejde i et team, som leverer dataprodukter af høj kvalitet og afgørende værdiskabende betydning? Så er vores stilling i BI-kontoret måske noget for dig. Vi arbejder i Region Midtjylland professionelt med Business Intelligence til understøttelse af det daglige arbejde for alle regionens medarbejdere. Vi arbejder med en bred vifte af dataområder og omsætter organisationens informationsbehov til færdige dataprodukter, der skaber indsigt og understøtter forandring. Stillingen er placeret i It-afdelingens BI-kontor med 20 medarbejdere. BI-kontoret er et kontor dedikeret til at sørge for, at organisationens beslutningstagere har den rigtige viden på det rigtige tidspunkt. Dine opgaver I stillingen i BI-kontoret kommer du til at varetage opgaver relateret til udvikling, vedligehold og drift af Region Midtjyllands Business Intelligence løsning. Du kommer i konkrete opgaver til at bringe dine evner til at arbejde struktureret og løsningsorienteret i spil i forhold til at få designet, udviklet og implementeret nye løsninger til platformen med det formål at sikre den fortsatte høje standard. Vi forventer, at du motiveres ved opgaver af høj kompleksitet, hvor du sammen med teamet finder frem til den bedst mulige løsning. Dine kompetencer Du har en relevant uddannelse, og du har praktisk erfaring med drift, vedligehold og udvikling af en BI-platform i en større organisation. Du har erfaring med MSBI Stakken med hovedvægt på MSSQL Performance optimering Udvikling og drift af større BI løsninger En bred vifte af værktøjer, som f.eks. TSQL, MDX, C#, Power Shell etc. Optimering / Best Practice / Opsætning af Windows og MSBI Derudover er det essentielt, at du har flair for problemknusning, arbejder struktureret, er løsningsorienteret i din tilgang til opgaver og har en høj grad af selvstændighed og eget initiativ. Du får En dagligdag med fuld fart på. Engagerede, kompetente og hjælpsomme kollegaer og et spændende, udfordrende og udviklende job. Hos os er der højt til loftet, fordi ambitionerne er skyhøje. Vi tror på, at samarbejde på tværs og løbende efteruddannelse er med til at skabe et godt arbejdsklima, hvor vi lærer nyt og inspirerer hinanden. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet med strategisk kompetenceudvikling og tilbyder dig gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling. Hos os er ledelse og samarbejde baseret på tillid og på vores værdier dialog, dygtighed og dristighed. Er du interesseret? Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte BI-chef Jonas Eskildsen Sørensen på 6094 3425 eller jonasoer@rm.dk . Send din ansøgning via linket her senest den 7. februar 2016. Vi forventer at holde samtaler den 11. februar 2016. Vi ønsker tiltrædelse snarest muligt. Din virksomhed Region Midtjylland driver alle hospitalerne i Midtjylland, og vi har en af landets største it-afdelinger med ca. 390 medarbejdere. It-afdelingen servicerer regionens ca. 35.000 brugere, der rundt omkring på hospitaler, regionshuse, ambulancer og institutioner er afhængige af sikker og stabil it-drift. Dit engagement i jobbet har derfor stor betydning for rigtig mange mennesker. Du kommer til at arbejde i en organisation, som i de kommende år står over for mange spændende projekter, der skal leveres så hurtigt og effektivt som muligt med høj leverance- og driftssikkerhed. Du kan læse mere om It-afdelingen på www.it.rm.dk . Da Region Midtjylland er igennem en væsentlig spareplan, vil omplaceringsramte medarbejdere der søger stillingen have fortrinsret til samtale. Send ansøgning Du har allerede ansøgt Du har allerede sendt din ansøgning med denne e-mail. Hvis du vil ændre din ansøgning, så henvend dig til den rette kontaktperson. Luk

Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Experienced consultants within Analytics/Business Intelligence Accenture 4.082 anmeldelser - København As an Analytics/Business Intelligence Consultant at Accenture, you will design and implement innovative business intelligence and predictive analytics solutions and/or work in the area of information management for Accenture’s clients. With a global presence and strength of more than quarter of million employees World Wide, Accenture will be able to provide you with exciting career opportunities and interesting project roles at our top Swedish and international clients. In such a context, every day is a day you will learn and grow your own consulting profile - inspired of those around you and the work you perform as a key member of the project team. At Accenture, you will be able to excel your CV even further! You will work in integrated teams with client personnel and Accenture colleagues from both the Danish practice and internationally. When leveraging Accenture’s global delivery models and leading edge, industry-specific assets you will generate high client benefits in terms of delivery efficiency, business value and quality. You will also benefit from our global training programs tailored to the various career paths at Accenture consisting of on-line and class-room trainings and network of expert communities. Accenture is looking for Analytics Consultants with 2-5 years [JGA1] of experience in designing and implementing business intelligence and analytics solutions or from working with information management/enterprise content management projects in any of market leading software platforms, examples including: SAS, Informatica, Microsoft BI, IBM Cognos, SAP, Oracle, Teradata and MicroStrategy. The position is based out of our office in Copenhagen and may include travel. Key responsibilities may include: Business requirements analysis and Analytics solution design Data and information strategy definition as part of overall enterprise architecture strategy Facilitation of software selection of Analytics/BI tools Development, test and deployment of Analytics/BI solutions Reviewing and supervising design components development Participating in program-wide technology capacity planning, deployment, troubleshooting, and performance tuning activities Learning and adopting Accenture's Analytics/BI approaches, methodologies and assets Networking with Accenture’s global network of experts and delivery centers 2 dage siden - gem job » Vis eller anvend på job Anbefalede job IT-arkitekt til DSB's BI-løsninger DSB - Taastrup IT-Jobbank - 3 dage siden French Sales Manager FindaCargo - København Indeed - 3 dage siden Nem ansøgning gennem Indeed Send en e-mail til en ven med dette job Job på Accenture i København Om denne virksomhed Accenture 4.082 anmeldelser Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting,... Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område perl-Developer Adapt A/S - København Adapt is a dynamic workplace where you’ll be working in a team with some of the best colleagues in the industry and given the opportunity to expand your skill set. Conversely, we expect you to contribute with your experience and knowledge. Your role will be to work closely with other developers, UX designer, project manager and the rest of the organisation to develop innovative perl solutions for our customers. This involves: needs analysis, solution proposals and solution implementation. The main tasks are: #Development in perl #Sparring with key stakeholders: UX Designers, project managers, clients and other developers Desired skills: We expect you to have an understanding and interest in our clients business and to be passionate about Open Source. This combination makes you a valuable sounding board for both developers, creative and sales department. The ideal candidate has: #A few years experience with professional perl development #In depth knowledge of relational databases #Good knowledge of the most common protocols and standards used for web development (HTTP, HTML, XML, SMTP) #Knowledge of Open Source software development #Minimum 2 years experience with web application development #Knowledge of development within agile processes in teams #Working proficiency in spoken and written English As a person you are serious, reliable and professional with a technical overview. You thrive on deadlines and can remain calm and collected in a busy and sometimes hectic working environment. Your work is always top notch and you take pride in delivering code of the highest standard. Being a team player, you are happy to help your colleagues and will do everything you can to make sure all projects are successful. Website for more information: www.adapt.eu Contact information: If you have questions regarding this position, please contact Development Director, Christian Borup, tel. +45 3341 1050 or mail job@adapt.dk with “FAO: CD and HR” in the subject line. To apply for this position, please email your application and CV to job@adapt.dk with "Adapt Perl Developer" in the subject line. Applications should be received by Monday 25 January 2016. During the recruitment process, we use work profiling, tests and working cases. Recruiters please don’t contact us regarding this open position, we don’t reply! perl.org - 3 dage siden - gem job » Vis eller anvend på job Send en e-mail til en ven med dette job Perl Developer Job i København Job på Adapt i København Gennemse job - Om Indeed - Hjælpecenter Cookies hjælper os med at levere vores tjenester. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Software Engineer Job Akamai Technologies - København Location: Copenhagen, DK Posted Date: 2016-01-15 00:00:00.0 Category: Engineering ID: 48255 Overview: About the Job Build the next-generation video streaming systems using multicast and peer to peer. You will be involved in writing and designing cross-platform client and server side software. You will write most of your code in Java using our internally developed programming framework. About the Team We are a small team of approximately 10 developers all with masters or PhD degrees in computer science or mathematics. Our team is located in Copenhagen a few minutes walk from Nørreport station and we work together with other Akamai teams around the world on developing technologies for distributing media content. Responsibilities: * Collaborate with other software engineers on design and implementation. * Take responsibility for the success of projects; including actively following up with other Akamai employees. * Develop, extend, maintain, test and document our core streaming technology including dynamic allocation of distributed resources in response to changing real-time demands. * Integrate with media codecs, players, encoders and DRM systems, network infrastructure, mobile devices, smart TVs, etc. Qualifications: Basic Qualifications * Solid and demonstrated skills in writing and understanding complex computer software. * Strong analytical skills. * Fluent in written and spoken English. Desired Qualifications * PhD or masters degree in computer science or mathematics. * Broad and deep knowledge about IP, UDP, TCP, and socket programming. * Experience using object-oriented asynchronous programming frameworks. * Experience using the Java core language. About Akamai: Akamai® is the leading content delivery network (CDN) providing cloud services that help deliver, optimize, and secure online content and business applications. At the foundation of Akamai solutions, the Akamai Intelligent Platform™ enables unmatched speed, reliability, and security–backed by expertise and relentless innovation–to improve reach and invisibility across the web. Akamai removes the complexities of connecting the increasingly mobile world, supporting 24/7 consumer demand, and enabling enterprises to more securely leverage the cloud. To learn how Akamai is accelerating the pace of innovation in a hyperconnected world, visit www.akamai.com, and follow @Akamaijobs on Twitter. Akamai Technologies is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status. EEO is the Law . Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Country Director of Delivery Avanade - København The Country Director of Delivery is based in Copenhagen, and is responsible for managing contract delivery risk across the Avanade Country project portfolio and driving continuous improvements in the industrialization and globalization of our delivery capabilities. This position is part of the Country leadership team as well as the part of broader Geography Delivery leadership team. Responsibilities include: defining the processes, procedures and tools that govern Delivery Management in Country, ensuring consistent execution against global standards and – most importantly – building a world-class delivery team (recruitment, development, coaching, mentoring). The role will also serve as a member of the broader delivery community and will be expected to support and influence delivery programs, and drive the country-wide adoption of processes to implement these programs. This individual will require strong credibility and working relationships with the geography Director of Delivery, country General Manager and geography Market Unit Leads Leads. A special focus will lie on evolving our delivery capabilities and teaming as we move into more complex and larger deal structures, and work increasingly across the various matrices within Avanade (geographies, service lines, channels). Equally the position will play an active role in customer interactions, both in sales, by supporting team in the shaping of complex solutions and driving sales through lead generation, and in delivery by providing thought leadership to our customers and supporting the execution of delivery of these solutions or services. Including: Deal shaping and quality assurance through the sales cycle Ensuring adequate and rightly sized QA processes within project delivery Remediation and stabilization of critical delivery situations on site Interim Program Management in defining projects for the country / geography Executive Sales support for Delivery portion of complex/large proposals ACCOUNTABILITIES: Accountable for country delivery operations and cross-market-unit portfolio oversight. Accountable for country quality and risk management. Accountable for optimizing the overall cost to serve (at Country portfolio level) by collaborating with the Market Units to leverage the appropriate mix of delivery locations and workforces. Accountable for Delivery Management (DM) career path framework, skill family and SA/DL/QAD process governance. Accountable for the governance of solution architect/planning processes and delivery management processes/controls to ensure cross-service line consistency. Accountable for enabling the processes, tools and delivery reporting to manage delivery compliance and internal controls – including promulgating global policy and tools/metrics uptake Accountable for analyzing country portfolio delivery reports; coordinating and monitor remediation actions Accountable for DM skill family training curriculum and roadmaps Accountable for DM skill family communications and communities Accountable for solution architect, delivery lead and QA director certification sponsorships (not approvals) within the country RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead the overall delivery management capabilities within the country Grow the Delivery capability, both within the delivery function and also across and within service lines – develop a strong leadership capability within country and – longer-term – across service lines Collaborating with Market Units on the recovery actions on problem jobs Drive alignment of The Avanade Delivery Model with all stakeholders in the geography Build strong working relationships with the Nordic Leadership Team (incl. other country Directors of Delivery, market unit leads, CTO teams, and functional / core services teams) Promote the Delivery agenda among Nordic Delivery Leadership Playing a lead role in country / geography deal approval calls when appropriate Engagement with GDN leadership participation to ensure delivery health in multi-site projects Cost optimization and differentiation by driving the delivery industrialization and innovation program, and the implementation of The Avanade Delivery Model in the geography Provide interim Program Management or stabilization on site for projects in critical delivery state or when projects are of significant importance for the geography Support selected proposal teams with delivery content when appropriate Qualifications KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS (TECHNICAL AND FUNCTIONAL): Strong leader combining Delivery Management vision and ability to execute on it Exceptionally strong people skills across diverse geographies and cultures Ability to influence Geography Delivery Management agenda Significant experience with complex large scale and multi-site deliveries Superior program and project management skills, methods and techniques Advanced knowledge of project estimation techniques and project QA reviews Strong deal review and risk identification and mitigation skills Strong coaching and mentoring skills Certified Solution Architect (SISA or AOSA) and Certified Delivery Lead (SIDL) PROFESSIONAL BACKGROUND Consulting and Leadership experience (10+ years) Deep understanding of key Project, Program and Service Management disciplines (estimating, work planning, contract management, scope management, user acceptance, customer management, service management etc.) Demonstrated understanding of delivery methodologies Demonstrated managerial and leadership expertise Significant experience leading large projects for customers Ability to deliver strong messages and ensure compliance Experience “turning around” projects PROFESSIONAL SKILLS: Excellent verbal and written communication skills (Danish and English) with proven ability to lead discussions with senior executives Customer oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills Outstanding people management skills Requisition ID - 37691 3 dage siden - gem job » Vis eller Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Service Delivery Lead Avanade - København Avanade is entering an exciting phase of activity in its continuing delivery of application management services to our new and established client base. We are looking for an experienced Service Delivery Manager (SDM) to ensure a professional and efficient management of all aspects of service delivery, and hereby improve outcomes for our clients. The SDM will be responsible for co-coordinating the delivery of services into a key enterprise customer in the retail industry. The SDMwill play a vital role in creating long-term customer relationships, acting as the bridge between the client and our operational delivery teams. The key responsibility of the SDM is governance across all areas of their services including service management, incident and change management, continual service improvement and customer satisfaction as well as playing a key role in ensuring the highest level of operational service delivery. Role of the Service Delivery Manager The Service Delivery Manager will be fully accountable for all aspects of the delivery of the service. This will entail discharging the following list of responsibilities: Manage service delivery using an evidence informed approach to improve outcomes for clients Oversee the creation of the support capability in our Global Delivery Centre’s and ensure that it is suitably staffed and trained to provide the service; including processes, procedures and tools. Ensure service related documentation is accurate and kept up-to-date at all times. Ensure quality of service meets contractual requirements, legal obligations and organisational policy and procedures. Oversee the initiation of the support service as new solutions are implemented. Engage in regular dialogue and reporting to senior members of client’s management teams. In the course of the above task it will be important to build a sound relationship based on competence and trust. Provide leadership and guidance to the near-shore support team(s) in the course of overseeing the delivery of the service. Manage relationships with potential 3rd party (parties) providing hardware, software, and application support in delivery partnership for the service. In the event that any aspect of service falls below the high standard expected a service improvement plan will be needed to address the issue and restore confidence. Ensure that service is delivered in a pro-active manner and that preventative maintenance measures are undertaken in a timely manner. Identify risks and issues, ensuring appropriate documentation, reporting, proposed mitigation plans and communication. Provide a monthly service reports to Client and Avanade management. Manage the cost of delivering the service to remain within budget and thus achieve expected levels of profitability. Support business development activities within the continued growth of Avanade’s relationship with our clients. Coordinate and participate in monitoring, review and auditing processes related to service delivery Qualifications Characteristics and experience required of the Service Delivery Manager The Service Delivery Manager will be an experienced manager of the provision of support services. The selected individual is likely to have many of the following qualities: Extensive experience of the management of support services gained through provision of service to a variety of clients - probably gained in a service company environment. Experience with retail industry is considered an advantage but not a must Experience and a proven track record of successfully managing a custom developed application. Significant experience in leading teams in a distributed setup. Proven capability in client management in the context of a demanding service level based contract with penalties associated with non delivery to expectation. Proven contract management skills including management of 3rd parties and sub-contractors. A trained support practitioner with suitable qualifications such as ITIL certification. Demonstrable capability to motivate individuals and drive high performance teams. Experience in assisting business development initiatives from a consulting delivery perspective. Self-Driven and Setting high standards of performance for self and others, assumes responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks, and self-imposes standards of excellence rather than just having them imposed Effectively managing one’s time and resources to ensure work is completed efficiently and effectively Using appropriate methods and interpersonal skills to help build a cohesive team whether as a leader or a member, facilitating the completion of team goals. Ability to operate within agreed budget and timeframes. Demonstrated proficiency in preparing client/service documentation. Additional Details The following additional information will be of interested to prospective candidates: The work will be located in Greater Copenhagen, Denmark. Periodic travel to Slovakia can be expected; this will apply at the start of the service and at least annually thereafter. The SDM will be reporting to the Avanade Denmark Director of Delivery Requisition ID - 37692 3 dage siden - gem job » Vis eller anvend på job Send en e-mail til en ven med dette job Service Delivery Lead Job i København Job på Avanade i København Gennemse job - Om Indeed - Hjælpecenter Cookies hjælper os med at levere vores tjenester. Embedded SW Engineer for an initial 6 month freelance contract
assignment. The customer is developing new technology for networked
consumer audio in the home and we are looking for candidates who
have their core strength in Embedded programming, but also
comfortable in operating in all layers of software. The key skills/experience required are: - Good Embedded programming skills - C/C++ - Linux/Android - Audio technologies (ALSA, Codec's, DSP or Drivers) - Network technologies (TCP, UDO and WiFi drivers) - Distributed systems This is to start on site in Denmark as soon as possible. If you are interested and available or coming available soon please
send your CV to me ASAP and I can call to discuss further.
